intro: Tanacetum trifoliolatum, commonly known as the three-leaf tansy, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils in full sun. It is often used in traditional medicine for its aromatic properties and has a long history of cultivation for both ornamental and therapeutic purposes.
